channel.title: Google on rmoff's random ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Google on rmoff's random ramblings

item.title: Advanced Googling for OBIEE information
item.description:
Want to find all PDFs from Oracle about OBIEE?

There’s some interesting ones that this turned up on Oracle’s public FTP. In particular:

  • BI EE Environmental and Multi-User Development Migration Processes
  • Securing Oracle BI Enterprise Edition

(There’s also PowerPoint files on there including this one but Google doesn’t seem to index them)

You can use Google’s Advanced Search page to build similar queries:

item.title: Google vs Bing
item.description:
There’s been a bit of hype about Bing recently, so I thought I’d try it out in trying to get to the bottom of this question on the OBIEE forum.

The question was around the nqschangepassword utility and the error it’s reporting: nQSError: 46090 The odbc.ini file could not found or could not be accessed.

I did a google for the error to see what other issues could cause the error. Google showed up the forum posting in question, plus the Siebel 794 message reference PDF (no v10 reference guide yet :( ) (in blogging this I’ll now probably show up on the list too!)

item.title: Google and Korean OTN forums
item.description:
Why does Google more often than not return the korean (kr) version of OTN forums for a match, but not english?

If I search Google for “Send notification:” “oracle.ons.Notification” the top hit is for kr.forums.oracle.com/forums/thread.jspa?threadID=650662

If you strip the kr from the URL you get this, which makes more sense given the locality when doing the search in Google.

Only mildly irritating, but odd behaviour nonetheless
